title: T-Mobile’s Trade-In Deal: Get $1,000 Off Your Dusty Old Phones
description: Even if your phone looks like a truck drove over it, T-Mobile says it'll give you $1,000 for it. Starting December 13th, swap your ancient device for shiny new phones.
author: Irene Okpanachi
excerpt: Even if your phone looks like a truck drove over it, T-Mobile says it'll give you $1,000 for it. Starting December 13th, swap your ancient device for shiny new phones.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. Trade-ins cut the cost of a new phone greatly, and let you exchange your old device for credit toward the purchase. The better the condition of your current phone, the higher the trade-in value. If you're looking for opportunities to switch phones, here's your shot.  T-Mobile is offering an incredible deal for any customer on their Go5G Next plan. You can trade in your phone in any condition and get up to $1,000 off the iPhone 16 series, Galaxy S24 line, and other phone models.  T-Mobile will take your phone anyhow it is New information coming from a document shared with The Mobile Report, possibly from T-Mobile itself, reveals that T-Mobile’s is up to a $1,000 discount off the iPhone 16 Pro and Galaxy S24+. Before now, the deal was detailed a few weeks ago, alongside another offer where you get four free iPhones if you're a new customer signed up for the “4 for $25 each” deal.  Image Credit: Peter Holden/TalkAndroid The deal included a trade-in component where you could exchange devices as old as a Samsung Galaxy S9 or iPhone 11 Pro to get the full $830 off the new iPhone 16, or receive a half credit of $415 for devices as old as the iPhone 6. It seems the carrier has updated the deal to allow customers trade in devices in any condition, even if they are damaged or non-functional. Also, if you're on one of T-Mobile's Go5G Next plans, such as for 55+, Military, or First Responders, you can still trade in a damaged device and get up to $800 off a new one. While this isn't the full $1,000 credit available to other customers, it’s still quite a steal. Image: T-Mobile Related: T-Mobile Adds Three New 5G Home Internet Plans Check your device's eligibility Starting on Friday, December 13th, T-Mobile new trade-in deals will be available. You can take advantage of them through their official website, the T-Life app, or the physical T-Mobile stores around you. Image: Apple Below are the devices you can trade in for up to $1000 off a new iPhone 16 or Samsung Galaxy S24 series phone, depending on their model and condition: iPhone 16 series Up to $1000 off: iPhone 13 Pro, 13 Pro Max, 14 Pro, 14 Pro Max, 15 Pro, 15 Pro Max. Up to $830 off: iPhone 12 Pro, 12 Pro Max, 11 Pro, 11 Pro Max, 12, 12 mini, 13, 13 mini, 14, 14 Plus, 15, 15 Plus. Up to $500 off: iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 6S, 6S Plus, 7, 7 Plus, 8, 8 Plus, X, XR, XS, XS Max, 11, SE 2nd Gen, SE 3rd Gen. Up to $415 off: iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 6S, 6S Plus, 7, 7 Plus, 8, 8 Plus, X, XR, XS, XS Max, 11, SE (2nd Gen), SE (3rd Gen). Samsung Galaxy S24 series Up to $1000 off: Galaxy S22 Ultra, S23 Ultra, S24 Ultra, Z Fold5, Z Flip5. Up to $830 off: Galaxy S9, S9+, S10, S10e, S10+, S10 5G, S20 FE, S20, S20+, S20 Ultra, S21 FE, S21, S21+, S21 Ultra, S22, S22+, S23 FE, S23, S23+, S24, S24+, S24 Ultra, Z Flip3, Z Fold3, Z Fold4, Z Flip4. Up to $500 off: Galaxy S6, S6 Edge, S6 Edge+, S7, S7 edge, S7 Active, S7 edge duo, S8, S8+, S8 Active, A32, A32 5G, A51, A51 5G, A52, A52 5G, A53 5G, A54 5G, A71, A71 5G, A21, A23, A14 5G, A15 5G, Note8. Up to $415 off: Galaxy S8, S8+, S8 Active, Note8, A51, A71 5G, A52, A52 5G, A53 5G, A54 5G, A35, A71, A51 5G, A32, A32 5G, Z Fold, Z Fold 2, Z Flip, Z Flip 5G. Irene is an experienced writer with four years in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

Trade-ins cut the cost of a new phone greatly, and let you exchange your old device for credit toward the purchase. The better the condition of your current phone, the higher the trade-in value. If you're looking for opportunities to switch phones, here's your shot. 

T-Mobile is offering an incredible deal for any customer on their Go5G Next plan. You can trade in your phone in any condition and get up to $1,000 off the iPhone 16 series, Galaxy S24 line, and other phone models. 

T-Mobile will take your phone anyhow it is

New information coming from a document shared with The Mobile Report, possibly from T-Mobile itself, reveals that T-Mobile’s is up to a $1,000 discount off the iPhone 16 Pro and Galaxy S24+. Before now, the deal was detailed a few weeks ago, alongside another offer where you get four free iPhones if you're a new customer signed up for the “4 for $25 each” deal. 

The deal included a trade-in component where you could exchange devices as old as a Samsung Galaxy S9 or iPhone 11 Pro to get the full $830 off the new iPhone 16, or receive a half credit of $415 for devices as old as the iPhone 6. It seems the carrier has updated the deal to allow customers trade in devices in any condition, even if they are damaged or non-functional.

Also, if you're on one of T-Mobile's Go5G Next plans, such as for 55+, Military, or First Responders, you can still trade in a damaged device and get up to $800 off a new one. While this isn't the full $1,000 credit available to other customers, it’s still quite a steal.

Related: T-Mobile Adds Three New 5G Home Internet Plans

Check your device's eligibility

Starting on Friday, December 13th, T-Mobile new trade-in deals will be available. You can take advantage of them through their official website, the T-Life app, or the physical T-Mobile stores around you.

Below are the devices you can trade in for up to $1000 off a new iPhone 16 or Samsung Galaxy S24 series phone, depending on their model and condition:

iPhone 16 series

  • Up to $1000 off: iPhone 13 Pro, 13 Pro Max, 14 Pro, 14 Pro Max, 15 Pro, 15 Pro Max.
  • Up to $830 off: iPhone 12 Pro, 12 Pro Max, 11 Pro, 11 Pro Max, 12, 12 mini, 13, 13 mini, 14, 14 Plus, 15, 15 Plus.
  • Up to $500 off: iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 6S, 6S Plus, 7, 7 Plus, 8, 8 Plus, X, XR, XS, XS Max, 11, SE 2nd Gen, SE 3rd Gen.
  • Up to $415 off: iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 6S, 6S Plus, 7, 7 Plus, 8, 8 Plus, X, XR, XS, XS Max, 11, SE (2nd Gen), SE (3rd Gen).

Samsung Galaxy S24 series

  • Up to $1000 off: Galaxy S22 Ultra, S23 Ultra, S24 Ultra, Z Fold5, Z Flip5.
  • Up to $830 off: Galaxy S9, S9+, S10, S10e, S10+, S10 5G, S20 FE, S20, S20+, S20 Ultra, S21 FE, S21, S21+, S21 Ultra, S22, S22+, S23 FE, S23, S23+, S24, S24+, S24 Ultra, Z Flip3, Z Fold3, Z Fold4, Z Flip4.
  • Up to $500 off: Galaxy S6, S6 Edge, S6 Edge+, S7, S7 edge, S7 Active, S7 edge duo, S8, S8+, S8 Active, A32, A32 5G, A51, A51 5G, A52, A52 5G, A53 5G, A54 5G, A71, A71 5G, A21, A23, A14 5G, A15 5G, Note8.
  • Up to $415 off: Galaxy S8, S8+, S8 Active, Note8, A51, A71 5G, A52, A52 5G, A53 5G, A54 5G, A35, A71, A51 5G, A32, A32 5G, Z Fold, Z Fold 2, Z Flip, Z Flip 5G.

Irene is an experienced writer with four years in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating.
